item.title: Forrest add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description:
"What an astonishing thing a book is. It's a flat object made from a tree with flexible parts on which are imprinted lots of funny dark squiggles. But one glance at it and you're inside the mind of another person, maybe somebody dead for thousands of years. Across the millennia, an author is speaking clearly and silently inside your head, directly to you. Writing is perhaps the greatest of human inventions, binding together people who never knew each other, citizens of distant epochs. Books break the shackles of time. A book is proof that humans are capable of working magic."
[<i>Cosmos, Part 11: The Persistence of Memory</i> (1980)]" -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Galileo Galilei
item.description: "I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use." -- Galileo Galilei

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Aldo Leopold
item.description: "At first blush I am tempted to conclude that a satisfactory hobby must be in large degree useless, inefficient, laborious, or irrelevant." -- Aldo Leopold

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Raymond Dasmann
item.description: "Avoid standardized proliferation of the ordinary at the expense of the irreplaceable." -- Raymond Dasmann

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Margaret Bonnano
item.description: "It is only possible to live happily ever after on a day to day basis. " -- Margaret Bonnano

item.title: Forrest add a quote by J. Michael Straczynski
item.description: "The past tempts us, the present confuses us, and the future frightens us. And our lives slip away, moment by moment, lost in that vast terrible in-between. But there is still time to seize that one last fragile moment. " -- J. Michael Straczynski

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Sir Frederick Pollock
item.description: "I forget how many thousand eggs go wrong for one codfish that gets hatched. But as Berkeley said long ago, it is idle to censure the creation as wasteful if you believe in a creator who has unlimited stuff to play with." -- Sir Frederick Pollock

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Aldo Leopold
item.description: "We shall never achieve harmony with the land, anymore than we shall achieve absolute justice or liberty for people. In these higher aspirations the important thing is not to achieve but to strive." -- Aldo Leopold

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Aldo Leopold
item.description: "The last word in ignorance is the man who says of an animal or plant: 'What good is it?" -- Aldo Leopold

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Almost any sect, cult, or religion will legislate its creed into law if it acquires the political power to do so." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Forrest add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "The truth may be puzzling. It may take some work to grapple with. It may be counterintuitive. It may contradict deeply held prejudices. It may not be consonant with what we desperately want to be true. But our preferences do not determine what's true." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Forrest add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "If this is going to be a Christian nation that doesn't help the poor, either we have to pretend that Jesus was just as selfish as we are, or we've got to acknowledge that He commanded us to love the poor and serve the needy without condition and then admit that we just don't want to do it." -- Stephen Colbert
